title: Mozbackup didn't backup local folders
content:
Hi

I have been using Thunderbird for years and I have recently upgraded my computer and migrated from Windows 7 to Windows 10. I run Mozbackup regularly after a previous experience taught me to backup via that system. However, mozbackup did not restore my local folders. The inbox was fine but that was it - no contacts or history etc etc. I used the non local IMAP email protocol to ensure I could reload in case of a crash. Neither appears to have worked as intended. Can you please advise how I can get my data back? I have contacted my ISP who were of no assistance.

Regards

Chris
creator: aussiechris

title: Unable to send an email,  receive okay but cannot send
content:
When I try to send an email I get this message "The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.iprimus.com.au failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again."

Any suggestions Cheers Greg
creator: gregdonald

title: TB; ATTACHMENT DOWNLOADS STOP GOING TO PUBLIC DOCUMENTS
content: ALL OF A SUDDEN ATTACHMENTS TO MY EMAILS STOPPED GOING TO PUBLIC DOWNLOADS AND ARE NOW GOING TO APPDATA/LOCAL/TEMP. HOW DO I GET IT BACK TO PUBLIC DOWNLOADS? DO NOT SEE SETTING FOR THIS IN TB???
creator: j856979

title: Thunderbird move from Windows 10 to Windows 11 fails with "Your Thunderbird profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible"
content:
Hello,

Have tried repeatedly moving Thunderbird 102.10.0 from Win10 to Win11 using various means (USB drive, OneDrive, map local network drive, etc). No use. The instructions cannot be simpler, yet the result is the same every time. "Your Thunderbird profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible"

I don't know what else to try. My source %AppData%\Roaming\Thunderbird directory is abt. 11GB in size. Have been using it for 11y and would hate to lose all of my old email.

Any advice is greatly appreciated. Thank you so much in advance. Vlad
creator: vladd2

title: On startup Thunderbird opens wrong content in last opened tab
content: I have 9 email accounts configured in Thunderbird (TB). I typically have a half a dozen tabs open at a time in TB, generally the same half a dozen. For at least a year now when I re-open TB the same number of tabs open, with the last-selected tab selected. So far all is well, except that the selected tab switches from the email account that it was open in against when I shut down TB to the first account in the Folders pane. I then have to switch it back to the correct account every time. It's gotten annoying enough that I've now joined this Support site so I can ask how to fix this. I tried the "open the profiles folder, quit TB, delete the session.json file and re-open TB" dance, but all that did was cause it to forget all of the previously opened tabs. I re-opened them in the desired order, selected the 4th one at random, then quit TB. When I re-started it, the 4th tab was selected, but the content was the first account in the list instead of the one it should have been. For reference purposes, all the other tabs still have the appropriate accounts open in them. I have the same version of Thunderbird installed on 2 different Windows 10 computers, and both of them are manifesting this behavior. I'm currently running TB 102.10.0 (32-bit). Please advise as to how I can fix this. If there is any other information that I can gather that will assist you with resolving this issue please let me know. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
creator: salindley0

title: All messages in my Storage Folders have disappeared
content: All the emails that I have saved into Storage Files Folders have totally disappeared. The Sub Folders are still there with '0' messages showing. I have tried a few of the help options but have been unsuccessful. Any advise from anyone who can shine any light on this would be appreciated. I do understand that if worse comes to worse then I can just reinstate them from a back up. Thanks so much.
creator: starthom

title: Help re JavaScript Events in Advanced Edit for link
content: I just want to add a onmouseover/onmouseout event for a link The Attribute field is simple because it's a dropdown menu But the Value field is blank and I cannot find a dictionary. I want to change the bg color for a link in a table on mouseover Thunderbird accepts "obj.style.color" but will not accept "obj.style.color = "green"" - Any suggestions? Thanks

title: Forgotten username
content: I need to update my email address book but have forgotten my username name and don't know what url details mean?
creator: trenna48

title: Shared Inbox - Can Tags and Notes be seen by everyone using the same mailbox?
content:
My team and I are using Thunderbird and one shared inbox.

There's 3 of us. Each one of us have their own folder and we have a common folder called "Completed"

When a new email comes in, it gets sent into the shared inbox. There it gets assigned to a member based on the nature of the email.

Is it possible to attach global notes / tag to the emails so that the each person in the inbox can see that tag and read that note and edit it if needed, which would respectively update it for the rest of the people using the inbox? Similar to a ticketing system but quite basic.
creator: martineli.works

title: The change password help instructions do not help.
content: The change password help instructions do not help. After clicking on the menu icon, there is no 'preferences' dropdown (using windows 10) on my computer. I have tried all the other dropdowns to no avail. Is there another way to change passwords in Thunderbird for those of us who do not have the 'preferences' dropdown after we click the menu icon?
creator: KnappAppraisers

title: TB new mail id lookup slow
content:
I moved TB to a new faster PC along with its profiles. All is working much faster now with one exception. I click on "Write" and a new mail panel appears. Now I start to enter the email id in the TO field. TB takes a long time to populate the email id. Also slow in the CC field or BCC field. The Subject and Body fields accept input at normal fast speed.

Any clue what is wrong or how to fix? Thanks.
creator: wilfrid.morrison

title: Thunderbird duplicate emails
content: When I send an email from thunderbird it sends two identical emails each time. If I send the email from outlook it sends only one. Is there a setting that needs to be changed? I have to run thunderbird so I can send emails from ccc estimating software. Thanks Matt

title: Contacts Address
content: This morning, I had my contacts in the Address Book. I deleted the ones without a phone number, I didn't think it would matter. These contacts were added automatically on setting up installed TB. On looking in my PC Google contacts list, they were not there. Same on my Smart Android phone. Luckilly, I was clever enough to replace them all from the Google Contacts Bin. I exported them in Vcard format to import into my Personal Address Book. Can I delete one contact from any TB place without it being deleted anywhere else?

If I try to create a new message filter Thunderbird freezes when I get to the point of allocating the message to a folder. I can set up new folders.

Anyone any ways to fix this?

content: My Thunderbird app does not pick up email addresses from my Thunderbird Contacts when I type a first name or surname into the "To" line for a new email. Up till yesterday it worked fine. Today it does not. I'm using Thunderbird to access my Gmail email account. I have the latest Thunderbird upgrade: 102.10.0 (64 bit) on my MacBook Air since it came out 12 April 2023. title: Moving TB Inbox/Sent mail to TB files, loses mail
content:
Hello Thunderbird, I have two laptops and two mobiles sychronised to my TB Account of which the main email address is over Gmail/Imap using the laptops Windows 10 OS (emails are only read on the handsets}. A fault has recently occured when moving the Inbox/Sent emails into the TB folders: the emails are getting lost. This situation occurs when:

  • the email is dragged & dropped between the TB columns; &
  • the mouse is right-clicked and the 'Move-to' option selected and subsequently, the 'Move-to the particular file' selected.

On both methods the email leaves the Inbox/Sent column but does not reappear in the chosen File (nor does it appear in the Deleted box)i.e. becomes lost. All guidance and suggestions are welcome. Kind regards, Tim Simpson
creator: timsimpson320

title: unwanted icons on incoming mail
content:
New "feature" since last update 102.10.0 (64-bit): Some, but not all, new/incoming messages are marked with a gold diamond or star icon.

It is a minor problem, but annoying.

How can I stop Thunderbird from doing that?
creator: patriciacravener

title: Deleting using DEL and ARROW keys?  Focus leaves inbox after deleting msg.
content:
Greetings.

I use the mouse as little as possible so I want to use the ARROW and DEL keys to delete messages in my Inbox.

The problem is after deleting a message the blue bar (highlight message) greys... focus goes to "Find in page" of the next message. So I must mouse over the message subject, select it, then delete. And repeat.

Is there a way to keep the focus in the Inbox list so I can just scroll (ARROW UP/DN keys) and delete the desired messages?

Kind Regards,

JRTinz
creator: jrtinz1

title: Thunderbird Crashes using Wayland when trying to print. @ gtk_printer_get_name
content:
Thunderbird 102.10.0 (64-bit) Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS (GNU/Linux 5.15.0-70-generic x86_64) GNOME Shell 42.5

When you File > Print, it opens a print window. When you click Print on that, Thunderbird crashes. As a workaround, in the Config Editor I changed print.prefer_system_dialog from False to True. Now it no longer crashes. I have a feeling it may be due to Wayland being disabled, as I'm using Xorg. At the time of crash, in the small window i sent a crash report. These are the contents:

title: setting up 2 email accounts on the same server
content: 2 email accounts on the same server work fine when directly on the server (Yahoo). In Thuinderbird one account can receive mail but not send, the other can send but not receive mail. Tried to delete the accounts to start over but can only delete one of the accounts. I am sure I screwed something up when first starting out as I am a newbie to Thunderbird. I did do an uninstall but that only changed data on my machine, not in the mozilla account. Thanks for your help.
creator: aeturek

title: Still can't dismiss calendar events... :(
content:
The problem is now going on for months, several people have this issue, but there still is not even an "official" response to this (but the previous thread has been archived now... :( )

The issue is still that week(s) old events, that are long done (but might need to stay in the calendar for historical reminders), all the sudden pop up and you can't not select dismiss (all)/snooze. You just can close the pop up window, but then a few hours later, the same even (in the past) still keeps popping up.

This get very annoying, very fast...
creator: PCWorxLA
